intro: Pleiocarpa bakueana, commonly known as the African starfruit or African custard apple, is a tropical shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces edible, yellow-orange berries that are typically harvested when fully ripe. Its fruit has a sweet, acidic flavor and is often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils.
